column4: I'm not sure if this is a place to ask this, but does anyone know if it's possible to somehow tune my Gnome/Ubuntu installation to make windows draw faster or at least the whole window at one time, instead of different parts of it being drawn sequentially?
what video driver are you using
are you sure this is about my graphics card? but ATI open source driver and the card itself is Mobile Radeon 9700
not but the best performance is probably with the ATI proprietary driver
I've tested with the proprietary driver and the performance is 10x worse
but I don't know what the problem is but the windows should not be drawing that slow
it might have been the settings, but I don't think any setting can cause a 10x drop in performance
they're not VERY slow, but enough to be annoying... on Win XP everything is lightning fast
but Desktop Effects (Compiz) runs smooth enough
try turning off desktop effects and see if that helps performance
I don't have desktop effects turned on, but I know they're smooth
besides, for instance, window resizing is equally VERY slow both with and without effects
are you running at a high resolution?
I don't use ATI but it sounds related
so you still think it's graphics related? beucase for me it doesn't make sense because it's just plain flat 2D
